CatDescriptText: Cleo Keith, beautician, 3351 McNeil Place, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "To be frank with you, I don't want either one. HOwever, if the money is really needed, I think that an increase in the sales tax would be better because people only have to buy the necessities and do not have to purchase those luxury articles which would be taxable."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Cleo Keith wearing light colored coat with wide lapels, and light colored hat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunders Flowers, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
